subject: Re: [junit] Re: Frustrations when extending JUnit 4
msgSnippet: Hi David, I can say I m required to use JUnit 4.3.1. The extension I m working on will let users of our library to take screenshots when tests failed running
messageBody:
Hi David,

I can say I'm required to use JUnit 4.3.1. The
extension I'm working on will let users of our library
to take screenshots when tests failed running inside
Eclipse. Pretty much I have to use the same version as
the Eclipse plug-in.

I'm looking forward to JUnit 4.5 :)

Best regards,
-Alex


--- David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

> Alex,
>
>
>
> On Nov 19, 2007 2:33 PM, Alex Ruiz
> <alruiz15@...> wrote:
>
> > Unfortunately, I'm stuck with JUnit 4.3.1.
>
> Because you're required, or prefer, not to use the
> latest version as a
> library? (Not to belabor the point, but it's worth
> knowing how long
> it takes features to make their way from the
> published version onto
> people's desktops, and why.)
>
> Thanks again for your ideas on the other
> extensibility concerns--I'll
> look forward to your review of how some of them are
> handled in JUnit
> 4.5. :-)
>
> David
>
